result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonell J. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonell J. Thompson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonell J. Thompson was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:12 p.m. Defendant Jonell J. Thompson in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Jonell J. Thompson in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Sowinski/Richards/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Jail -  49 days
Jail credit - 49 days (time served)

records.addlTxt:
2:21 p.m. Defendant Jonell J. Thompson in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 2 - Granted.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Finlan/Court statement to sentencing.
Court sentence
WHS/POP - 12 months
CC/DNA surcharge/Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Apology letter to Walmart or Payless whichever is appropriate
Restitution in amount of $61.94, includes statutory surcharge, jointly and severally of co-defendants
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given
Adj. 2:33 p.m.

02:56 pm - Attorney Patrick Howard Finlan in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Finlan files Authorization.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:12 pm - Defendant Jonell J. Thompson in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per contact with PD office - defendant is eligible for PD appointment - unable to appoint as of today's date.  Court adjourns.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jonell J. Thompson in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:27
Defendant statement - was qualified for PD- but has not been appointed one yet- was told she would have one named today- 
Court advises her to contact the PD's office to confirm new date
Bail continued  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

02:27 pm - Defendant Jonell J. Thompson in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
